item.title: Introducing module federation for Blazor components
item.description: Introduction With the release of .NET 7, Microsoft included a feature to render Blazor components in JavaScript applications (RegisterCustomElement<T>). This helps those who want to slowly migrate JavaScript applications to Blazor, but unfortunately, won’t work for exposing Blazor components as microfrontends, as it works only for JavaScript applications deployed together with the Blazor application. In this post, I’ll present a nuget package that I’ve created as a prototype to try to solve this problem, exposing Blazor components with module federation for other applications to consume.
